00001 #########################################################################
00002 #
00003 #  Implements trigonometric functions
00004 #
00005 package Parser::Function::trig;
00006 use strict;
00007 our @ISA = qw(Parser::Function);
00008 
00009 #
00010 #  Check that the argument is numeric (complex or real)
00011 #
00012 sub _check {(shift)->checkNumeric(@_)}
00013 
00014 #
00015 #  For complex arguments, call the complex version,
00016 #  Otherwise call the version below.
00017 #
00018 sub _eval {
00019   my $self = shift; my $name = $self->{name};
00020   return $_[0]->$name if Value::isComplex($_[0]);
00021   $self->$name(@_);
00022 }
00023 
00024 #
00025 #  Check the arguments and return the (real or complex) result.
00026 #
00027 sub _call {
00028   my $self = shift; my $name = shift;
00029   Value::Error("Function '%s' has too many inputs",$name) if scalar(@_) > 1;
00030   Value::Error("Function '%s' has too few inputs",$name) if scalar(@_) == 0;
00031   my $n = $_[0];
00032   return $self->$name($n) if Value::matchNumber($n);
00033   my $context = (Value::isValue($n) ? $n : $self)->context;
00034   $self->Package("Complex")->promote($context,$n)->$name;
00035 }
00036 
00037 #
00038 #  Should make better errors about division by zero and
00039 #  roots of negatives here.
00040 #
00041 sub sin {shift; CORE::sin($_[0])}
00042 sub cos {shift; CORE::cos($_[0])}
00043 sub tan {shift; CORE::sin($_[0])/CORE::cos($_[0])}
00044 sub sec {shift; 1/CORE::cos($_[0])}
00045 sub csc {shift; 1/CORE::sin($_[0])}
00046 sub cot {shift; CORE::cos($_[0])/CORE::sin($_[0])}
00047 
00048 sub asin {shift; CORE::atan2($_[0],CORE::sqrt(1-$_[0]*$_[0]))}
00049 sub acos {shift; CORE::atan2(CORE::sqrt(1-$_[0]*$_[0]),$_[0])}
00050 sub atan {shift; CORE::atan2($_[0],1)}
00051 sub asec {(shift)->acos(1/$_[0])}
00052 sub acsc {(shift)->asin(1/$_[0])}
00053 sub acot {shift; CORE::atan2(1,$_[0])}
00054 
00055 #########################################################################
00056 
00057 1;
